wikipedia_page.main: Walter Douglas Hincks  (3 September 1906–12 June 1961) was a British entomologist and museum curator. He was a world expert on the Dermaptera.

response: Wagstaffe worked with the Honorary Curators of Entomology, Walter Douglas Hincks and A Smith to collect specimens for the museum from Askham Bog. He also worked with Hincks to bring the Ellis collection of insects to the museum in 1945.

link_mentions.page: List of keepers and curators of the Yorkshire Museum

response: After his death, Reginald Wagstaffe and Walter Douglas Hincks (both naturalists) were instrumental in purchasing part of his collection for the Yorkshire Museum. Over 100,000 specimens were purchased in 1945.
